result.execSummary:
James R Potter was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means James R Potter was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James R Potter

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
(clerked by AJP)
Defendant James R Potter in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant James R Potter in custody.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 14CM381 AND 14CF295

14CM381 (INIT):  
NG pleas entered.
Bond set for 14CM381
Plea hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

14CF295 (REQUEST FOR EXTRADITION):  Defense waives extradition.  Court accepts defendant's waiver as knowing, voluntary and intelligently given.  Defendant signs waiver of extradition.  Remanded to the custody of Sheriff.
